newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dollar ends Friday on weaker note.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dollar ends Friday on weaker note.

text.p: Canada's dollar ended softer on Friday, extending its recent weakness as investors pondered the direction of Canadian interest rates, analysts said.
The currency finished around C$1.3840 (US$0.7225) on Friday from Thursday's close at C$1.3815 (US$0.7238).
"It followed through weakness in the last few days," said I.D.E.A. analyst Harvinder Kalirai.
"The general perception is that the Canadian dollar cannot rally unless the Bank of Canada hikes rates," he said.
